alert.note: Alert for Appanoose; Davis; Mahaska; Monroe; Poweshiek; Wapello (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued August 19 at 2:55AM CDT until August 23 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values of 100 or above for several days. Highest heat index values may approach 109 by next week. The long duration of heat will result in cumulative heat impacts, adding to the danger of this event. * WHERE...Small portions of Central and Southern Iowa. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 9 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Today will be the beginning of an extended period of heat and humidity. The long duration of the heat can be particularly hard on the very young, the elderly and those with medical conditions.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
